thag6.13:1.1: The rain saturates things that are covered up;
thag6.13:1.2: it doesn’t saturate things that are open.
thag6.13:1.3: Therefore you should open up a covered thing,
thag6.13:1.4: so the rain will not saturate it.
thag6.13:2.1: The world is beaten down by death
thag6.13:2.3: The dart of craving has struck it down,
thag6.13:2.4: and it’s always fuming with desire.
thag6.13:3.1: The world is beaten down by death,
thag6.13:4.1: Three things are coming, like a wall of flame:
thag6.13:4.3: No power can stand before them,
thag6.13:4.4: and no speed’s enough to flee.
thag6.13:5.4: shortens your life by that much.
thag6.13:6.4: you have no time to be careless.
